snippet: With his candidacy battered by negative campaign ads, Newt Gingrich is adjusting his strategy to rescue his ailing campaign.
abstract: Newt Gingrich, with his Republican presidential candidacy battered by negative campaign ads and a disappointing showing in the Iowa caucuses, is adjusting his strategy to rescue his ailing campaign, aggressively swatting back at challenger Mitt Romney.

byline.contributor: Nicholas Confessore and Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Des Moines.

lead_paragraph: With his candidacy battered by negative campaign ads, Newt Gingrich is adjusting his strategy to rescue his ailing campaign.

headline.seo: A Frustrated Gingrich Lashes Back at Romney
headline.main: A Frustrated Gingrich Looks Past Iowa and Lashes Back at Romney
headline.print_headline: Frustrated Gingrich Lashes Back at Romney and Awaits the Next Round
